reviewText:
So, this is a somewhat challenging game actually. Basically, a meteor lands in a cemetary and is the impetus for the dead rising from the grave. The only way to defeat them? Bowling, Obviously....sheesh. :)

Anyway, you basically bowl against a zombie, and all the pins are zombies. There are buffs you can gather and use (which include large balls, rockets, plunger guns, etc...), and also penalties you can pick up and use against your zmbie competitor. Of course, it also gets the same opportunities to use buffs and hit you with penalties. They include icy lanes, narrow lanes, obstacles, and so on.

Your goal? To win each match and move on the the next lane. You get a day and night for each lane, so you will bowl each twice. If you lose, you have to try again until you win.

You can adjust the position of release as well as the ball speed before/as you throw.

That is pretty much it. Although this probably doesnt sound all that impressive, the game is actually a lot of fun. I cant imagine a person playing it and deciding they didnt like it. It's just cute, good casual bowling. Also fit for all ages.

7/10

reviewText: Zombie Bowl-o-Rama is nothing special, but might pass some idle time while you're on a long conference call. It feels very much like a well-crafted mobile game. The game consists of you bowling down a lane full of zombies, overcoming obstacles and traps like water on the bowling lane and deploying tricks that you earn to improve your game. The controls are okay, but odd. You use the mouse to adjust the power behind your roll and then once the ball is out of your hands, you directly control its movement with the mouse -- moving left to right.\n\nIt's an idle-time amusement and little more. Not worth the price, but not a broken or terrible game. If you're into this kind of thing, I'd wait until it hit a buck or two before buying. That's about the price of a decent iPad game and that's about what this is.

reviewText:
Weird and Suprisingly Enjoyable

This game is indeed very strange. Bowling and Zombies are not exactly the sort of things you would imagine would go well together and yet, here we are with 'Zombie Bowl-O-Rama' from Mumbo Jumbo, proving me totally wrong.

Why does it work so well? Its simple, it just adds so much crazy and fun to each scene, imagine chucking a giant lettuce against a bunch of disco dancing zombies or sending bees everywhere sliding a honey-ball across a icy path. It makes no sense but it happens to also be so playable too, simple controls keeping things very accessable.

As you can see I am slightly having issues with what to exactly say. I guess all I can say is 'Lets Go Bowling for Brains!'

reviewText:
I know what you're thinking: Holy crap, this game looks really stupid!

Well, it is stupid, but it's also fun.  In most cases, video game bowling sucks (I've never been a fan of REAL bowling, either), but this game has a nice twist to it.  While rolling your ball down the lane, you can somewhat control it and when doing so, you can grab different positive and negative items.

Positive items help YOU, whereas negative items hurt your opponent, which can be a real person or the AI.  This adds a whole new dynamic to the game and turns what could've been a real flop into something quite entertaining.

There are achievements (if that means a whole lot to you) and a normal" bowling mode
date: just in case you don't want to deal with crazy game items.  I don't know WHY you'd want to do that
recommended: but it's there.\n\nYou can play against a real person if you want.  This is restricted to local gameplay on ONE PC
hoursPlayed: so you can't bowl against anyone online."

If you're looking for a bowling simulator: Get out. You will NOT find that here. This game is nowhere NEAR to a bowling simulator like Brunswick.

While I won this game on the Steam Auction house (the Steam Winter Sale 2014 promotion) I still showed interest in this game regardless if I won it or not.

So, the story line is simple: There is none. It's literally just challenges against CPU opponets that get progressively harder as your background and lane change. Or you can opt to bowl against friends, or CPU robots that don't get harder (the non-story mode)

There is NO BLOOD OR GORE, while there is dismemberment, it's nothing gruesome like in Mortal Kombat or any other violent game that support dismemberment in a very vicious and violent manor.

The pins are zombies. They function as if you hit a human with very thin bones in the shin with a bowling ball.

Powerups are such bs in this game, but it's definitely what makes this game fun. You can pick them up while throwing the ball down the lane (It's like Polar Bowler, if you've ever played that game) and then use them to either give yourself a boost or give your opponet a little harder challenge (based on your powerup you collected)

While gameplay is simplistic, the bowling ball is even more simplistic. You guide where your ball goes using the mouse. While i'm not too fond of this mechanic, it can definitely make or break your frame.

Good, fun, time killer - 8/10
Fun time killing game.

I didn't expect a whole lot from this game, but was I surprised.

Yes, it is repetitive, but it is a great little time waster, with the smallest bit of strategy thrown in.

Don't pay full price, but otherwise, quite enjoyable.

Got this in a cheap bundle and it is my favourite of those in the bundle so far. It is very casual and is a great game to play for 30mins. It certainly is worth getting cheap and if you have friends that'll enjoy it with you then even the full price isn't too bad.

The 'story mode' part was a little easy and the story was almost non-existent. But as a bit of occasional fun it succeeds.
It'd probably be even more fun with other people and would get a little boring in single player after a little while.

If you have ever wanted to take down zombies with a bowling ball this is the game for you!

reviewText:
Zombie Bowl-O-Rama. What's there to say really? It's a bowling game where you can pickup various power-ups on the lanes. The power-ups are both offensive and defensive with the offensive ones varying in power between forcing a gutter ball and being completely useless and the defensive ones vary between guaranteeing a strike and guaranteeing a spare.

There is not really much else to say about this game, it is very short, simple and random.

Do you like Bowling? Do you like Zombies? Do you like Randomness?

Unless the answer to all three is a resounding HELL YEAH" then you should stay away from Zombie Bowl-O-Rama because that's all it really is
date: and it's not particularly good at any of it either."

reviewText:
My review and suggestion is solely based on this game advertised as a single player game.  As a multiplayer game, I would rate it very differently.  But since its advertised as a single player game, and that is why I bought it, that is how I'm scoring it.

The tricks and power ups are very similar to mario kart.  They allow you to boost your game and weaken your enemies.  This is great when playing against friends who will struggle with the same mouse controls that you have.  But, when playing against AI, it just plain sucks.  The computer is not phased by the tricks you throw at it while you get blown out when the AI uses tricks against you.  You can throw tricks against it frame after frame and it will still bowl 200+ games.  But the super sensitive mouse controls will have you struggling even without the AI's interference.  The AI also seems to luck into the tricks much more frequently which seems to be how they scale difficulty as you advance in single player, making an already frustrating game unbeatable.

Its a cute and gimmicky concept, but when you want to advance the single player functionality, its frustrating, buggy, and eventually very boring.

The game is lacking simply options like difficulty sliders, options to skip animations automatically, and how tricks/powerups should work.

Its all about the money.  If you find this in a bundle, its worth a small distraction.  However, I would not recommend paying full price, or even buying it alone as its replay appeal is very brief and its single player implementation is very poor.  As I stated above, if you are playing against other human characters, this might be a very fun game (please keep that in mind when reading reviews).

reviewText: Fun for a brief time, but multi-player is local only, so unless you are in the same room and share a mouse, the multi-player is essentially a lie.  Worth one or two dollars, but no more for the single-player experience.  Online multi-player would make this infinitely re-playable and worth full price.  If a game is local co-op on Steam, they must advertise as local co-op.  No idea why this does not apply to the multi-player attribute as well, as it makes a difference in our purchasing choices.

Suprisingly, Zombie Bowl-o-Rama is a fun game with a nice cartooney style. Athough not revolutionary, it's fun for a casual gaming session and it's core gameplay is fun however that's all there is. Personally, i think this game should include a challenge mode. In short this is a fun game that lacks alternate gameplay and becomes repetative but is unique and well polished.

ゾンビとボウリング対決だ！負けたら食われるぞ！
ピンになってるゾンビを多くタオした方が価値のシンプルなルール！
スキルで自分のボールを強化もできるし敵のターンの妨害もできる。
スキルの種類はかなり多く、相性みたいな物も存在する。小さくしたら銃は当たらなかったりして意図してるかどうかは知らないけど戦略みたいな物も。
Bought it for a buck during a previous Steam Sale. It was probably worth about $2.50. Decently fun.

Fun for casual bowling.

It's bowling with zombies, there isn't really much else to say. No seriously, it has cool mechanics, but gets bland quickly. Remember to play with friends for the best quality of this hilarious game. 6.5/10

stupid but fun classic!

Meh. Nice idea but ultimately unimpressive. Had the story been prioritized, and told using comics or more cinematics like the intro and ending, I think the overall experience would have been more enjoyable. Also, there was no feeling of danger from the zombies, no consequence for missing them... missed oportunity I feel.
Fine for a wee mess about. Get it when its on the cheap. 2 player also.

I see many negative reviews for this little game and to be honest I don't know what you could expect from an iPhone game ported to PC. I think its a fun game worth a few bucks. It could use more abilities and traps yes, but thats all I can think of that is lacking.
a good little game to spend some time

its like bowling but with a twist

I honestly don't know why I have so many hours on this game, but it was worth it. I really recommend the game, since it is a fun party game, and can be a good time waster as well. I'm still trying to get that 300 score achievement...

Not worth the asking price of $10, but if you can get this on a super sale for about $1 or $2, or if you have some Trading Card Steam Wallet cash to burn, it's worth getting. A fun little time-killer.
